Package booklist

Class BookList

java.lang.Object
booklist.BookList
public class BookList extends Object
The BookList class that allows the user to store the Books data in a circular Linkedlist, and manipulate its contents.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    private class 
    BookList.Node
    The inner Node class for linking Book objects in the circular Linkedlist.

  • Field Summary

    Description

    head
    The head (start) of the BookList

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    BookList()
    The default constructor which initializes head to null

  • Field Details

    • head

      private BookList.Node head
      The head (start) of the BookList

  • Constructor Details

    • BookList

      public BookList()
      The default constructor which initializes head to null

  • Method Details

    • addToStart

      public void addToStart(Book b)
      Adds the Book passed as an argument at the beginning of the BookList making it the new head
      Parameters:
      b - Book object for which a new Node holding it will be added at the beginning as the new head of BookList

    • storeRecordsByYear

      public void storeRecordsByYear(int yr)
      Finds all the book records based on a given year, and stores them in a file called yr.txt
      Parameters:
      yr - the year book records have to be found from

    • insertBefore

      public boolean insertBefore(long isbn, Book b)
      Searches for the first occurrence of a Node holding a Book object with the ISBN that equals to the passed isbn value. If the Node is found, inserts a new Node in the list (holding Book b) before the found node. Otherwise, does nothing.
      Parameters:
      isbn - ISBN of the Book before whose Node a new Node will be inserted
      b - Book for which a new Node holding it will be created and inserted
      Returns:
      boolean value true if the Node was successfully created and inserted or false otherwise

    • insertBetween

      public boolean insertBetween(long isbn1, long isbn2, Book b)
      Searches for the first occurrence of the first two consecutive nodes holding Book objects with ISBN values equal to isbn1 and isbn2, respectively. If found, the method inserts a new Node in the list (holding Book b) in between these two nodes. Otherwise, does nothing.
      Parameters:
      isbn1 - ISBN of the Book after whose Node a new Node will be inserted
      isbn2 - ISBN of the Book before whose Node a new Node will be inserted
      b - Book for which a new Node holding it will be created and inserted
      Returns:
      boolean value true if the Node was successfully created and inserted or false otherwise

    • displayContent

      public void displayContent()
      Displays the records of the calling BookList object.

    • delConsecutiveRepeatedRecords

      public boolean delConsecutiveRepeatedRecords()
      Finds all consecutive repeated nodes, each having the same Book record, and deletes them, if any.
      Returns:
      boolean value true if there are no duplicates in the BookList anymore, otherwise or if the BookList was empty returns false.

    • addToEnd

      public void addToEnd(Book b)
      Adds a Node holding a Book object passed as an argument to the end of the BookList before the head
      Parameters:
      b - Book object for which a new Node holding it will be created and added

    • extractAuthList

      public BookList extractAuthList(String aut)
      Searches all records in the calling list for Book objects that have the author given to the method. If found the method will create a new singular circular list that includes only the records of that author.
      Parameters:
      aut - name of the author whose books the method has to find
      Returns:
      BookList that includes only the records of the specified author

    • swap

      public boolean swap(long isbn1, long isbn2)
      Rearranges the records in the list by swapping the first pair of nodes storing a Book record with isbn1 and a Book record with isbn2
      Parameters:
      isbn1 - ISBN of the first Book to be swapped
      isbn2 - ISBN of the second Book to be swapped
      Returns:
      boolean value true if the records were successfully swapped or false otherwise. If any of the passed ISBNs do not exist in the list, then nothing happens and the method returns false.

    • commit

      public void commit()
      Commits the contents of the list by storing its contents in a file called Update_Books.txt
